page.title: 12DEER RESEARCH,RHUM_BREEDING
page.content: Events such as seasonal coat change & casting of antlers are influenced by density & food supplies. As population increases & food decreases, survival, growth & habitat use of deer are affected, in particular stags. Their average lifespan & antler size decrease & antler casting & cleaning is retarded. Hinds conceive later & fecundity is reduced. Calf mortality in winter increases & seasonal coat change is later. Breeding success causes differ in hind & stag. Main factors affecting{lifetime reproduct_ {ive success of hinds}are quality of their home ranges & size of the matri_ lineal group.The 2 most important{fac_ {tors affecting stag success}are size & duration of harem holding. These are closely related to fighting success which is dependant on body size/condi_ tion. Others are rut area & lifespan.
